page.title: 06WORLD WAR 2 IN MYLOR
page.content: Mylor was a busy village in world war 2. 8 people were killed in a German bombing raid on the main entrance road to Mylor. A row of five houses were demolished in another such raid.The houses were bulldozed and now form the Lemon Arms carpark. A stream running through the village centre was diverted to the main river to provide the main river with a greater flow to combat a possible incendury attack. A jetty was built by the Church for Motor Torpedo Boats to use in practise for the D-Day invasions. A Polish P.O.W.camp was built on the Barton/Restonguet road.The Poles being Christians erected a cross on the site that can still be seen today.
